register.description: IP Revision Identifier (X.Y.R) Used by software to track features, bugs, and compatibility

bitfield.description: IP Revision

register.description: Information about the IP module's hardware configuration. It provides information about the RTL generic parameters.

bitfield.description: The VTNF module is present when this parameter is set.

bitenum.description: SIMCOP receives a 200 MHz clock driving all sub-modules
SIMCOP receives a 400 MHz clock. Some modules receive the 400 Mhz clock and others receive 400/2=200 Mhz.
SIMCOP receives only one main clock for all the modules.
SIMCOP receives a main clock @ 304 Mhz plus a clock @ 426 Mhz for LDC, NSF and iMX.

bitfield.description: This parameter defines the image buffer count.
The NSF3 module is present when this parameter is set.
The ROT #a module is present when this parameter is set.
The iMX #b module and the CMD#b, COEFF#b memories are present when this parameter is set.
The iMX #a module and the CMD#a, COEFF#a memories are present when this parameter is set.
The NSF2 module is present when this parameter is set.
The VLCD module and the QUANT, HUFFMAN, BITSTREAM memories are present when this parameter is set.
The DCT module is present when this parameter is set.
The LDC module and the LDC LUT are present when this parameter is set.

register.description: This register controls the various parameters of the OCP interface

bitfield.description: Software reset

register.description: End Of Interrupt number specification

bitfield.description: Software End Of Interrupt (EOI) control. Write number of interrupt output.

register.description: Per-event raw interrupt status vector Raw status is set even if event is not enabled. Write 1 to set the (raw) status, mostly for debug.

bitfield.description: This bit field is reserved and users should write the reset value to this bit location.
Event triggered by the HW sequencer to instruct the CPU to process a macro block
Event triggered by the SIMCOP DMA. This event is automatically cleared at SIMCOP level when it is cleared at SIMCOP DMA level Check SIMCOP DMA IRQ registers.
This bit field is reserved and users should write the reset value to this bit location.
An OCP error has been received on the OCPMB master port.
This bit field is reserved and users should write the reset value to this bit location. A decode error has been signaled by the VLCDJ module
Event triggered when the HW sequencer finishes the sequence: - the sequence step counter has reached the limit - all accelerator and DMA events for the last sequence step have been received.
Event triggered when STEP3 is activated by the HW sequencer
Event triggered when STEP2 is activated by the HW sequencer
Event triggered when STEP1 is activated by the HW sequencer
Event triggered when STEP0 is activated by the HW sequencer
This event is triggered by LDC when a macro-block has been processed
Event triggered by the VTNF imaging accelerator when processing of a block is done.
This bit field is reserved and users should write the reset value to this bit location. Event triggered by the ROT #a engine
This bit field is reserved and users should write the reset value to this bit location. Event triggered when iMX has executed a SLEEP instruction.
This bit field is reserved and users should write the reset value to this bit location. Event triggered when iMX has executed a SLEEP instruction.
This bit field is reserved and users should write the reset value to this bit location. Event triggered by the NSF2 imaging accelerator when processing of a block is done.
This bit field is reserved and users should write the reset value to this bit location. This event is triggered by VLCDJ when a macro-bloc has been processed (encode/decode)

This bit field is reserved and users should write the reset value to this bit location.Event triggered when a block has been processed by the DCT module and the filter outcome has been stored to an image buffer.
This event is triggered by LDC when a full frame has been processed
Event triggered by the SIMCOP DMA. This event is automatically cleared at SIMCOP level when it is cleared at SIMCOP DMA level Check SIMCOP DMA IRQ registers.

register.description: Per-event 'enabled' interrupt status vector Enabled status isn't set unless event is enabled. Write 1 to clear the status after interrupt has been serviced (raw status gets cleared, i.e. even if not enabled). When AND mode is selected (.IRQx_MODE=1, x is the IRQ line number), the SIMCOP_HL_IRQSTATUS__x register equals 0 until all enabled events have occured. Intermediate state can be read from SIMCOP_HL_IRQSTATUS_RAW__x

Event triggered when the HW sequencer finishes the sequence: - the sequence step counter has reached the limit - all accelerator and DMA events for the last sequence step have been received.
Event triggered when STEP3 is activated by the HW sequencer
Event triggered when STEP2 is activated by the HW sequencer
Event triggered when STEP1 is activated by the HW sequencer
Event triggered when STEP0 is activated by the HW sequencer
This event is triggered by LDC when a macro-block has been processed
Event triggered by the VTNF imaging accelerator when processing of a block is done.
This bit field is reserved and users should write the reset value to this bit location. Event triggered by the ROT #a engine
This bit field is reserved and users should write the reset value to this bit location. Event triggered when iMX has executed a SLEEP instruction.
This bit field is reserved and users should write the reset value to this bit location. Event triggered when iMX has executed a SLEEP instruction.
This bit field is reserved and users should write the reset value to this bit location. Event triggered by the NSF2 imaging accelerator when processing of a block is done.
This bit field is reserved and users should write the reset value to this bit location. This event is triggered by VLCDJ when a macro-bloc has been processed (encode/decode)

This bit field is reserved and users should write the reset value to this bit location. Event triggered when a block has been processed by the DCT module and the filter outcome has been stored to an image buffer.
This event is triggered by LDC when a full frame has been processed
Event triggered by the SIMCOP DMA. Check SIMCOP DMA IRQ registers.

register.description: SIMCOP control register

bitfield.description: This bit field is reserved and users should write the reset value to this bit location.

Controls if bursts issued by LDC bridge could cross burst length boundaries. When this register is set, the LDC module only issues OCP aligned bursts. Register can only be used when LDC_R_MAX_BURST_LENGTH is 32, 64 or 128 bytes.

bitenum.description: No. OCP transactions must be splitted

bitfield.description: Limits the maximum burst length that could be used by LDC
This bit field is reserved and users should write the reset value to this bit location.
Limits the maximum number of outstanding LDC requests to LDC_R_TAG_CNT+1
This bit field is reserved and users should write the reset value to this bit location.
Reserved. Values written to this register are ignored. (register required for legacy SW)
This bit field is reserved and users should write the reset value to this bit location.
This bit field is reserved and users should write the reset value to this bit location. Switch for iMX # command memory
This bit field is reserved and users should write the reset value to this bit location. Switch for iMX #a command memory
This bit field is reserved and users should write the reset value to this bit location. Switch for huffman table
This bit field is reserved and users should write the reset value to this bit location. Switch for quantization table
This bit field is reserved and users should write the reset value to this bit location.
This bit field is reserved and users should write the reset value to this bit location.

This bit field is reserved and users should write the reset value to this bit location. Selects input data buffer for LDC. Memories attached to LDC as working memories can't be used by any other accelerators. HWSEQ or HWSEQ SW override settings are ignored for those memories.

This bit field is reserved and users should write the reset value to this bit location. Selects working memory for NSF. Memories attached to NSF as working memories can't be used by any other accelerators. HWSEQ or HWSEQ SW override settings are ignored for those memories.

bitenum.description: No working memory attached to NSF2. NSF2 can't be used.
Image buffers #a, #b, #c, #d used. Those image buffers can't be used for other purposes. This setting has higher priority than the context configuration
Image buffers #a #b used. Those image buffers can't be used for other purposes. This setting has higher priority than the context configuration

bitfield.description: Interrupt generation method

bitenum.description: The interrupt line is asserted when one of the events enabled in SIMCOP_HL_IRQENABLE_SET__3 / SIMCOP_HL_IRQENABLE_CLR__3 is pending
The interrupt line is asserted when all events enabled in SIMCOP_HL_IRQENABLE_SET__3 / SIMCOP_HL_IRQENABLE_CLR__3 are pending

bitfield.description: Interrupt generation method

bitenum.description: The interrupt line is asserted when one of the events enabled in SIMCOP_HL_IRQENABLE_SET__2 / SIMCOP_HL_IRQENABLE_CLR__2 is pending
The interrupt line is asserted when all events enabled in SIMCOP_HL_IRQENABLE_SET__2 / SIMCOP_HL_IRQENABLE_CLR__2 are pending

bitfield.description: Interrupt generation method

bitenum.description: The interrupt line is asserted when one of the events enabled in SIMCOP_HL_IRQENABLE_SET__1 / SIMCOP_HL_IRQENABLE_CLR__1 is pending
The interrupt line is asserted when all events enabled in SIMCOP_HL_IRQENABLE_SET__1 / SIMCOP_HL_IRQENABLE_CLR__1 are pending

bitfield.description: Interrupt generation method

bitenum.description: The interrupt line is asserted when one of the events enabled in SIMCOP_HL_IRQENABLE_SET__0 / SIMCOP_HL_IRQENABLE_CLR__0 is pending
The interrupt line is asserted when all events enabled in SIMCOP_HL_IRQENABLE_SET__0 / SIMCOP_HL_IRQENABLE_CLR__0 are pending

register.description: SIMCOP clock control register. Use to enable/disable the interface and functional clock of SIMCOP sub-modules. Disabled modules can't be accessed: read/writes return SResp=ERR

bitfield.description: This bit field is reserved and users should write the reset value to this bit location.

bitenum.description: Request shutdown of the sub-module. No effect if the sub-module clock is already off.
Request enable of the sub-module. No effect if the sub-module clock is already on.

bitfield.description: This bit field is reserved and users should write the reset value to this bit location.
This bit field is reserved and users should write the reset value to this bit location. ROT A

bitenum.description: Request shutdown of the sub-module. No effect if the sub-module clock is already off.
Request enable of the sub-module. No effect if the sub-module clock is already on.

bitfield.description: This bit field is reserved and users should write the reset value to this bit location. IMX B

bitenum.description: Request shutdown of the sub-module. No effect if the sub-module clock is already off.
Request enable of the sub-module. No effect if the sub-module clock is already on.

bitfield.description: This bit field is reserved and users should write the reset value to this bit location. IMX A

bitenum.description: Request shutdown of the sub-module. No effect if the sub-module clock is already off.
Request enable of the sub-module. No effect if the sub-module clock is already on.

bitfield.description: This bit field is reserved and users should write the reset value to this bit location. NSF2

bitenum.description: Request shutdown of the sub-module. No effect if the sub-module clock is already off.
Request enable of the sub-module. No effect if the sub-module clock is already on.

bitfield.description: This bit field is reserved and users should write the reset value to this bit location. VLCDJ

bitenum.description: Request shutdown of the sub-module. No effect if the sub-module clock is already off.
Request enable of the sub-module. No effect if the sub-module clock is already on.

bitfield.description: This bit field is reserved and users should write the reset value to this bit location. DCT

bitenum.description: Request shutdown of the sub-module. No effect if the sub-module clock is already off.
Request enable of the sub-module. No effect if the sub-module clock is already on.
Request shutdown of the sub-module. No effect if the sub-module clock is already off.
Request enable of the sub-module. No effect if the sub-module clock is already on.
Request shutdown of the sub-module. No effect if the sub-module clock is already off.
Request enable of the sub-module. No effect if the sub-module clock is already on.

register.description: Simcop control register

bitfield.description: This bit field is reserved and users should write the reset value to this bit location.

Limits the mean bandwidth (computed over one block) that the LDC module can request for read from system memory 0: The BW limiter is bypassed 1~4095: maximum number of bytes per cycle multiplied by 2^8. Examples: 1 : 1.6 MBytes/s @ 426 MHz 4095 : 6.8 GBytes/s @ 426 Mhz
